H6981.def: = type of partridge, of which there were at least three variaties in ancient Israel;  it lives in small flocks called coveys, lays a great many eggs, and prefers to run when in danger, flying only when necessary; even when it takes flight it flies for only a short distance before dropping back to the ground; habitat differs from one kind of partridge to another; the rock partridge is about 35 centimeters (14 inches) in length and has striking white cheeks with a black band running from its brow, through its eyes, down its neck, and curving around its breast; It also has striking black and chestnut stripes on its flanks; its back and wings are gray; the beak and legs are red; both sexes look alike; the black francolin is about the same size but has a slightly shorter tail; the male has a black breast and flanks; the female is a speckled brown; the sand partridge is the color of the local sand and is about half the size of the other two types; ◄ Alectoris graeca, Alectoris chukar, Francolinus francolinus, Ammoperdix heyi; ► clean animal, so may be eaten

H168.def: = construction ◄ made out of cloth or skins ► used as a temporary residence by nomads, soldiers, shepherds, and even as a sanctuary

H7778.def: = a person responsible for guarding the entrance of a town or building

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H4217.def: literally: the rising  (of the sun): = a cardinal direction indicating the direction of the rising sun

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H6828.def: = a mountain, identified with Jebel ʾel-Aqraʿ ◄ in northern Syria, ► known by the Canaanites as the mountain of the gods

H5045.def: =  an area of land located in the south of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}, consisting of little vegetation and with very little annual rainfall; inhabited by numerous peoples - initially by the Canaanites in {L:Arad<SDBH:עֲרָד>} and the {L:Amelekites<SDBH:עֲמָלֵקִי>}, later, the people of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}

H251.def: = son of one's father, whether from the same mother or not

H2691.def: = collection of dwellings, not surrounded by a wall

H6256.def: = a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H7651.def: = state in which a countable entity is seven in number

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H530.def: = state in which an object does not move

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H7778.def: = a person responsible for guarding the entrance of a town or building

H3957.def: = part of a building, enclosed by walls, floor, and ceiling

H214.def: = valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well-being

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H4931.def: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

H4668.def: = tool of a relatively small size, flat in shape with a number of small projections on one side, corresponding an equal number of holes in the bolt of a door;◄ made of wood or metal; ► used for removing the bolt from the outside by inserting it through a hole in the door; ≈ being entrusted with the key to an important building gives a certain amount of status and power

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H4557.def: = an oral or written account of something

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H4487.def: = action with which one determines or estimates the number of a collection of persons, objects, or events

H3627.def: = human-made object of any kind, usually specified by the context, ◄ of various makings ► and made for various purposes

H6944.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H5560.def: = finely ground flour ◄ from only the inner kernel of the wheat, resulting in a high quality flour

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H3828.def: = yellow or reddish gum produced by the Boswellia tree, a shrub that reaches 3 m high, with multiple trunks and small greenish or white flowers; the gum comes out in drops from the branches; ◄ Boswellia sacra; ► ingredient of the incense burned in the tabernacle

H1314.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H7543.def: = causative action by which humans mix spices together or with food ► so as to produce a fragrant or tasty blend

H1314.def: = tree of 2-3 meters tall, with small, wrinkled, three-part leaves, white flowers, and pea-sized red berries that have a fragrant yellow seed inside; the bark of younger branches is gray, turning brown with age; it grows in desert or semi-desert climates; ◄ Opobalsamum; ► the tree is wanted for its resin, which appears by itself in green droplets from the stems and branches, but collectors also make cuts in the branches to speed the process; the droplets turn from green to brown, clump together, and fall to the ground, where they are collected; the resin is used in holy anointing oil, as medicine, and as an ingredient of perfume

H41.def: = man; ◄ from {L:Kiriath-Jearim<SDBH:קִרְיַת יְעָרִים>}; ► father of {L:Ahio<SDBH:אַחְיֹו>} and {L:Uzza<SDBH:עֻזָּא>}/{L:Uzzah<SDBH:עֻזָּה>}

H792.def: = man, also known as {L:Ish-Boshet<SDBH:אִישׁ־בֹּשֶׁת>} and {L:Ishvi<SDBH:יִשְׁוִי>}; ◄ son of {L:Saul<SDBH:שָׁאוּל>}; tribe of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}; ► succeeded his father as king of the northern tribes until he was assassinated and {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>} took his place; ≈ the author or a redactor of 2 Samuel probably changed his name to Ish-Bosheth ("man of shame") to avoid references to the idol {L:Baal<SDBH:בַּעַל>}

H3083.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Gersom<SDBH:גֵּרְשֹׁום>}; tribe of {L:Levi<SDBH:לֵוִי>}; ► Levite assisting {L:Micah<SDBH:מִיכָיְהוּ>} and later the {L:Danites<SDBH:דָּנִי>} as {L:priest<SDBH:כֹּהֵן>}
